subject: Programming
title: Avoiding Side Effects
description: Learn Avoiding Side Effects in one minute.

hook.text: You call a function to check a password and it silently logs you out. That's a side effect.

buildup.text: Side effects are hidden behaviors â€” changes to state that the caller doesn't expect.

discovery.text: Pure functions take input and return output without modifying anything else. They're predictable.

twist.text: Real programs need side effects â€” writing to databases, sending emails. The trick is isolating them.

climax.text: Push side effects to the edges of your code. Keep the core logic pure and testable.

quiz.question: What is a pure function?
options: One that returns output without modifying external state
